item.title: Kelly add a quote by Washington Irving
item.description: "There is a sacredness in tears. They are not a mark of weakness, but of power. They speak more eloquently than ten thousand tongues. They are the messengers of overwhelming grief, of deep contrition and of unspeakable love." -- Washington Irving

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "Success is stumbling from failure to failure with no loss of enthusiasm." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Steven Wright
item.description: "What's another word for thesaurus?" -- Steven Wright

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "To lose one parent may be regarded as a misfortune; to lose both looks like carelessness." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Kelly add a quote by mark twain
item.description: "But who prays for Satan? Who, in eighteen centuries, has had the common humanity to pray for the one sinner that needed it most?" -- mark twain

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Robin Williams
item.description: "See, the problem is that God gives men a brain and a penis, and only enough blood to run one at a time." -- Robin Williams

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Charles J. Sykes
item.description: "Be nice to nerds. You may end up working for them. We all could." -- Charles J. Sykes

item.title: Kelly add a quote by W.C. Fields
item.description: "If at first you don't succeed, try, try again. Then quit. No use being a damn fool about it." -- W.C. Fields

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "When you are courting a nice girl an hour seems like a second. When you sit on a red-hot cinder a second seems like an hour. That's relativity." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Scott Adams
item.description: "The first time you see something that you have never seen before, you almost always know right away if you should eat it or run away from it." -- Scott Adams

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Jodi Picoult
item.description: "There are some dreams that get stuck between your teeth when you sleep, so that when you open your mouth to yawn awake they fly right out of you." -- Jodi Picoult

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Gustave Flaubert
item.description: "Do not read, as children do, to amuse yourself, or like the ambitious, for the purpose of instruction. No, read in order to live." -- Gustave Flaubert

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Vince Lombardi
item.description: "The man on top of the mountain didn't fall there." -- Vince Lombardi

item.title: Kelly add a quote by William W. Purkey
item.description: "You've gotta dance like there's nobody watching, Love like you'll never be hurt, Sing like there's nobody listening, And live like it's heaven on earth." -- William W. Purkey

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Leo Rosten
item.description: "I cannot believe that the purpose of life is to be happy. I think the purpose of life is to be useful, to be responsible, to be compassionate. It is, above all to matter, to count, to stand for something, to have made some difference that you lived at all.." -- Leo Rosten

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Isaac Asimov
item.description: "The saddest aspect of life right now is that science gathers knowledge faster than society gathers wisdom." -- Isaac Asimov

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Abigail Van Buren
item.description: "The best index to a person's character is how he treats people who can't do him any good, and how he treats people who can't fight back." -- Abigail Van Buren

item.title: Kelly add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "Never laugh at live dragons." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Dan Millman
item.description: "There are no ordinary moments." -- Dan Millman

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Elbert Hubbard
item.description: "God will not look you over for medals, degrees or diplomas but for scars." -- Elbert Hubbard

item.title: Kelly add a quote by William James
item.description: "The art of being wise is knowing what to overlook." -- William James

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Brian Tracy
item.description: "I've found that luck is quite predictable. If you want more luck, take more chances, Be more active, Show up more often." -- Brian Tracy

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Marjorie Pay Hinckley
item.description: "The only way to get through life is to laugh your way through it. You either have to laugh or cry. I prefer to laugh. Crying gives me a headache." -- Marjorie Pay Hinckley

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Harry Truman
item.description: "Fame is a vapor, popularity is an accident, riches take wings, those who cheer today may curse tomorrow and only one thing endures - character." -- Harry Truman

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Warren Buffett
item.description: "Somebody once said that in looking for people to hire, you look for three qualities: integrity, intelligence, and energy. And if you don’t have the first, the other two will kill you. You think about it; it’s true. If you hire somebody without [integrity], you really want them to be dumb and lazy." -- Warren Buffett

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Diana Gabaldon
item.description: "I stood still, vision blurring, and in that moment, I heard my heart break. It was a small, clean sound, like the snapping of a flower's stem." -- Diana Gabaldon

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Rowena Cherry
item.description: "Carpe Scrotum. Seize life by the testicles" -- Rowena Cherry

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Anaïs Nin
item.description: "We don't see things as they are, we see them as we are." -- Anaïs Nin

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Jonathan Swift
item.description: "May you live every day of your life." -- Jonathan Swift

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Judy Blume
item.description: "Let children read whatever they want and then talk about it with them. If parents and kids can talk together, we won't have as much censorship because we won't have as much fear." -- Judy Blume
